text: Bottle 500ml. [ As Gekkeikan Yuzu Nigori Sake ].Murky white - milky color with a virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy yuzu, citrus, zesty. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, zest, yuzu, dry, citrus - lemon, fruity. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat. Lovely if you like yuzu ;) [20160318]

Bottle share at Cotteridge Convention 2 - Thanks to Osprey for this new style tick. Pours milky white, aromas of yuzu and a little booze, sweet to taste with oranges and lemons, gritty mouthfeel. Different!

Bottle shared at the Canary wharf tasting 16/02/2016. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. Thick milky man milk, oily, thick. Aroma is hot alcohol, sharp orange rind, rice, paint stripper. Flavour is composed of milky, chalky, bitter lemon, tart, semi sweet, milky. Palate is horrid, chunky, chalky, thick, smoothie. Not a fan of this.

Bottle shared at Cotteridge Tasting II (2016), cheers Daniel!
Milky beige with yuzu aroma, sour milk porridge-like whilst also citrussy and sharp - like a boozy junior disprol - not sure if its for me!
Cotteridge Convention II. Bottled shared thanks to the osprey, cheers Daniel. Cloudy yellow/white milk looking sake. Aroma of sweet yoghurt. Taste is peach, yoghurt milk drink and sweet. Decent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at One Canada Square as Gekkeikan Yuzu Nigori Sake, 7%. Picked up in a Japanese shop. Separates in the bottle, so requires mixing. Thanks to Leighton for demonstrating the technique. Milky opaque pour, leaves a creamy dotted scummy residue on the glass. Aroma is key lime pie and Calpol. Body is smooth with low carbonation. Taste is pretty sweet yet dry, chalky and powdery, sour yuzu, meringue, tea, touch of booze. Certainly an interesting beverage. Pretty dry and powdery.

50cl bottle shared at the Level 42 tasting, London. Thanks to Daniel. It pours a milky white color wih bubbly white head. Aroma is sweet lime soapy with tangerine yuzu milk and caramel. Taste is big sweet yuzu candy caramel tangerine citrus and lactose. Medium bodied with no carbonation. Overall, weird

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2016 Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Daniel. Pours murky, milky white. Smells kind of like lemon meringue, with some lime accents. Medium sweet flavor with more tangy lemon, light acidity, vanilla frosting. Medium bodied with a drying, chalky texture. Sweet finish with more lemony tartness, ground up white rice, more vanilla, cake. Tasty enough.

Bottle thanks to Dirty D. It pours cloudy, creamy, milky jizz white. The nose is earthy, musty, creamy, milky, nutmeg, cinnamon, chalky and umami. The taste is creamy, chalky, chewy, musty, sweet preserved lemon, rice pudding, dirty milk, passion fruit and and earth with a dry, chewy finish. Medium body and chewy mouth feel. So very dry and chewy.
Pours a cloudy, milky, intranslucent white - like milk. Aroma is citrus yuzu. Taste is yuzu, sweet rice, lemon tart, very dry, slightly vinous. Textured mouthfeel.
Bottle at craigs. Pours like jizz, nose is fruity lemon, pineapple, taste is creamy, Yuzu, sweet, tart.

Murky jizz like white with a rice dregs lacing. Nose is bullish Yuzu and creamy dessert wine good times. Initial taste is lush stalky citrus, spicy. Carbonation is soft, chunky mouthfeel. Finishes rich funky lean half of dry creamy Yuzu, lingers long and slaps of sake.

Bottle. Pours like milk, white, creamy no head. The aroma os something else, smelling this transports you to a yuzu orchard, sharp citrus yuzu, lemon and grapefruit. Taste is strong of yuzu, grapefruit and floral. Slightly strange mouthfeel, kind of chalky and dry. A very special beverage.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours murky, jizz-looking, with no head. Aromas of creamy lemon dessert. Posset. Taste is lumpy, lobotomy, I mean lemony finish. Weird. No, in your innuendo.

bottle at home ... murky white ... no lacing .. massize yuzu .. sherbert citrus nose ... juicy fruits ... massive yuzu ... this is Devine .. zezty fruit ... juicy fruits ... dry yuzu ... yum yum yum ... dry chalcky finish ...

500 ml tall bottle bought at ParkNShop Superstore in Fanling.
Cloudy, hazy milky off-white colour mixed with lots of sake rice particles; Fragrant and sweet aroma of glutinous rice wine, with strong yuzu , perfume, sugar, light mashed pear fresh, floral and light alcohol; Mid to strong sweet taste of soupy sake rice , with strong yuzu tea, honey, rice particles, tartness, petals, pear puree, light alcohol and liquorices; 
Close to light body, Slightly slick and starchy palate; Mouth feel is a thinned Gekkeikan Nigori fused with yuzu tea concentrate. Lots of citrus mixed with honey plus Nigoris starchy rice turn into a very easy to drink Sake-yazu tea mixture. Sakes boozy edge is toned down even more so than the regular Nigori yet the booze-liquorice finish is still here. Sweet but pretty nice! Wet after taste; Starchy and fruity sweet to mouth.

Comments: This toned-down, yazu tea-heavy Nigori must be made for casual, non-committed drinkers in mind. Its so easy and refreshing to go down yet without much knock on even at 7% ABV. Its heretic, but damn its so nice for cooling down Summer heat like today. A perfect lady killer, you have been warned!
